data.title: Alumni News
data.meta_description: The office of Dean of Resources and Alumni (DoRA) is the backbone of IIT Kanpur
data.text:
Dr, Ajay Kumer (BT/EE/1984) has been appointed as the Director on Board of Sify Technologies. An Indian Administrative Service officer of the 1985 batch, Dr. Kumar last served as the Defense Secretary for the Government of India and has deep expertise in the technology and #policy domains. He has also played a pivotal role in nurturing the defense startup ecosystem through initiatives like Innovations for Defense Excellence.

Prof. Arvind Mithal (BT/EE/1969) passed away at the age of 77. He was Charles W. and Jennifer C. Johnson Professor in Computer Science and Engineering at MIT, head of the faculty of computer science in the Department of Electrical Engineering and Computer Science (EECS), and a pillar of the MIT community. He was honored with membership of the National Academy of Engineering in 2008 and the American Academy of Arts and Sciences in 2012, he became a member of the Indian National Academy of Sciences and fellow of the Association for Computing Machinery and received the Harry H. Goode Memorial Award from IEEE in 2012.

Mr. Rahul Garg (BT/EE/2001) established the DRG All-Rounder Award for B.Tech. students at the institute in memory of his late grandfather, Shri Deshraj Garg. The award will be given at the convocation ceremony along with cash reward and certificate starting in the year 2025 to a final year B.Tech. student from the Department of Electrical Engineering. Mr. Garg is the Founder & CEO of Moglix which is the largest B2B ecommerce unicorn of India and has global presence and has been listed in Fortune 40 Under 40 and Forbes Tycoons of Tomorrow.

Mr. Sanjiv Puri (BT/ME/1985) was appointed as the President of the Confederation of Indian Industry (CII) for 2024-25. He is the Chairman & MD, heads ITC Ltd, a conglomerate with businesses in FMCG, hotels, paperboards & packaging, agribusiness, and IT. He is also the Chairman of ITC Infotech India Ltd, its subsidiaries in the UK and US, and Surya Nepal Private Ltd.

Mr. Ranjit Shahani, former Managing Director and Vice Chairman at Novartis India Ltd. Mr. Shahani, an alumnus of IITK was a distinguished figure in the realms of industry, commerce, and pharmaceuticals. His influence in India's pharmaceutical and healthcare domains was profound, marked by his leadership across diverse organizations. He had also served as President Emeritus of Organization of Pharmaceuticals Producers of India (OPPI â a platform for multinational drugmakers) and Chairman of JB Chemicals & Pharmaceuticals.

Mr. Naveen Tewari received the Uttar Pradesh Gaurav Samman by Hon'ble Chief Minister, Shri Yogi Adityanath for elevating the Indian startup sector to global prominence. He was awarded this prestigious honor on UP Foundation Day held on 24 Jan. 2024. The award recognizes Mr. Tewari's exceptional entrepreneurial vision and outstanding achievements as a tech entrepreneur acknowledges the role he has played in putting the Indian start-up sector on the global map. Mr. Tewari is the founder of twin unicorns, InMobi, an AI-led advertising technology company, and Glance, an AI-led consumer technology company. He is the recipient of the Distinguished Alumnus Award 2013 by IITK.

Ms. Vartika Shukla, an alumnus of IIT Kanpur gets featured in 'The She List' of Top 100 Women of India in the Special Issue of India Today. She is currently serving as the Chairman and MD of Engineers India Limited. This 48th Anniversary Special features women achievers across the domains of politics, business, science, arts, entertainment, sports, education, law and defense. This issue pays a tribute to trailblazing women achievers who have contributed to the growth of India with their pursuit of professional excellence.

Mr. Ashish Karandikar (BT/EE/1995), currently serving as the Vice President of Engineering at NVIDIA, USA, donated generously to his alma mater to establish three endowed programs at the Department of Electrical Engineering. This generous contribution will pave the way for newer avenues of growth for our faculty, researchers, and students of the Electrical Engineering Department alike, thereby also contributing to the flourishing academic and R&D ecosystem at the institute.

The three programs include, Smt. Lata and Shri K.G. Karandikar Faculty Chair, awarded to IITK faculty; Karandikar Best Ph.D. Thesis Award, recognizing outstanding scholarly contributions celebrating exceptional doctoral theses; and Karandikar Student Scholarship, aiming to nurture and support students.

Prof. Rajendra Bordia was appointed as the President of the American Ceramic Society,organization that supports leading scientists, engineers, and educators from around the world in the discovery, manufacturing, and use of advanced ceramics and glasses. He will hold the presidency for one year.

Prof. Keshav Pingali received the ACM-IEEE CS Ken Kennedy Award. The Ken Kennedy Award recognizes groundbreaking achievements in parallel and high-performance computing. Prof. Pingali, faculty at Department of Computer Science, University of Texas, Austin, is a W.A."Tex" Moncrief Chair of Grid and Distributed Computing. He has made wide-ranging contributions to many areas of parallel computing including programming languages, compilers, and runtime systems for multicore, manycore and distributed computers. Prof. Pingali is also the CEO and Co-founder of Katana Graph, AI-powered Graph Intelligence Platform providing faster, deeper, and more accurate insights on massive and complex data.

Prof. Pradip Swarnakar was appointed as Senior Associate (Non-Resident) at Center for Strategic and International Studies (CSIS) under Energy Security and Climate Change Program. Prof. Swarnkar, an alumnus of IITK, is a faculty at HSS Dept. and specializes in the areas of Environmental Sociology and Social Network Analysis.The Center for Strategic and International Studies (CSIS) is a nonprofit policy research organization dedicated to advancing practical ideas to address the worldâs greatest challenges located in Washington D.C., USA.

Dr. Neeraj Kayal and Dr. Dipti Ranjan Sahoo have been awarded the prestigious Shanti Swarup Bhatnagar Prize for Science & Technology 2022.

Dr. Kayal currently serves as a Principal Researcher at Microsoft Research Lab in Bengaluru. He works in the areas of complexity theory, algorithms, and related areas of theoretical computer science.

Dr. Sahoo currently serves as Associate Dean (Infrastructure) and Professor of Structural Engineering in the Dept. of Civil Engineering in IIT Delhi. Prof. Sahooâs research interests encompass Performance-based earthquake design, Hybrid simulation and testing, Seismic fragility assessment, Finite element modeling, Passive vibration control, Fiber-reinforced concrete, High-strength materials, Steel-concrete composite structures, Sesmic strengthening techniques, and Structural fire engineering.

Mr. Vijay Parthasarthy, an alumnus of IITK, launched his book, The Golden Ladder on 8th Aug. 2023 in IIT Kanpur.It is a self-help book that teaches readers how to achieve success in business and in life. The book also includes a number of case studies of successful businesses and individuals who have used the principles of the Golden Ladder to achieve their goals.

Mr. Farhan Ahmad on getting appointed as the Chief Financial Officer at Enovix Corp.. He has earlier served as the Vice President, Investor Relations and Finance Strategy at Micron where he was responsible for driving long range strategic planning and cost competitiveness. He has also served at Credit Sussie as an Equity Analyst covering a wide range of stocks across Semiconductors, Semiconductor Capital Equipment and Cleantech

Shri Amit Agrawal has been appointed as the CEO of Unique Identification Authority of India (UIDAI). He is an officer of the 1993 batch IAS from the Chhattisgarh cadre. He has served as Additional Secretary in the Ministry of Electronics and Information Technology. Before that he was Additional Secretary and Joint Secretary in the Ministry of Finance. In Chhattisgarh, he served as the Finance Secretary and the Secretary in charge of the Departments of Commercial Tax and Technical Education in the State Government among other roles.

The Ministry of External Affairs appoints Shri Upender Singh Rawat as the next High Commissioner to Uganda. Shri Rawat is an Indian Foreign Service officer of 1998 batch. He is currently serving as the Ambassador of India to Panama. In his career, he has served in various capacities. He started as the third Secretary at the Embassy of India, Buenos Aires; served in Indian Diplomatic Missions in Slovakia, UK, and Mexico.

Prof. Rohit Verma gets appointed as the Dean of Darla Moore School of Business, University of South Carolina from 1 August 2023. He currently serves as the founding provost at VinUniversity in Hanoi, Vietnam, and is also a professor of operations, technology and information management at Cornell Universityâs SC Johnson College of Business.

Mr. Anil Bhandari (BT/ME/1969) passed away. He served as the Chairman of the Wheels Global Foundation (WGF)Advisory Board. He was known for his philanthropy and had instituted Gopal Das Bhandari Memorial Distinguished Teacher Award at IIT Kanpur. He was deeply involved in alumni activities and played a significant role in the construction of the Outreach Building on the IIT Kanpur campus. He was also involved in PanIIT alumni outreach.

Dr. Rathin Datta passed away in Chicago, USA. He was a Distinguished Alumnus of IIT Kanpur 2010 and recipient of the Director's Gold Medal in 1970. He was a renowned chemical engineer with more than 40 years of experience in developing and commercializing process and product technologies for both established and emerging companies. His career was devoted to renewable resources for energy and chemicals â development of innovative technologies, creating organizations and companies in this field and leading them to commercialization.

Mr. Saurabh Tripathi was appointed as the Leader, Global Financial Institutions Practice at Boston Consulting Group, Mumbai. His expertise lies in banking and financial services and has over 17 years of experience in consulting. He did his bachelor's in Electrical Engineering from IIT Kanpur in 1996 and was awarded the President's Gold Medal.

Mr. Anup Bagchi (MT/CHE/1977) got appointed as the next MD & CEO of ICICI Pru Life Insurance. Mr. Bagchi is currently serving as Executive Director of ICICI Bank and will take over in June this year. He has previously served in retail, banking, treasury, investment banking, small-scale industry, payment, and settlement systems, and has over three decades of experience in the financial services industry.

Mr. Anil Bansal (BT/MME/1977 ) has been named The South Asian Times Person of the Year 2022. He was felicitated by the Consul General of India in New York, Mr. Randhir Jaiswal. He is a serial entrepreneur with several successful ventures across software, finance, and real estate. He is the founder of First National Realty Management. He serves as a Board Member of Indo-American Arts Council. He is known for his philanthropy and has generously contributed towards the Gangwal School of Medical Sciences & Technology at IIT Kanpur.

IITK Distinguished Alumna, Prof. Meenakshi Narain passed away on 01 Jan. 2023. She was a prominent high-energy experimentalist and was deeply involved with the CMS experiment at the Large Hadron Collider at CERN. She did her MSC2 in Physics in 1984 from the Indian Institute of Technology, Kanpur. She was instrumental in discovering the top quark, the heaviest fundamental particle in 1995, and co-authored/authored over 850 articles in leading physics journals. She was a professor of physics and Chair of the Dept. of Physics at Brown University.

Dr. Deepak Pathak for getting awarded the 2022 Okawa Research Grant. He is one of seven professors in the U.S. to receive the prestigious grant from the Okawa Foundation for Information and Telecommunications. Dr. Pathak's research has focused on making robots adaptable to real-world environments. His work with legged robots has enabled them to maneuver across nearly any #terrain, climb high stairs and clamber over obstacles. He has also demonstrated novel ways to teach robots tasks, including having mobile manipulators learn from watching humans or even YouTube videos.

An esteemed alumnus of IIT Kanpur, Mr. Ajay Dubey and his wife Mrs. Rooma Dubey have contributed USD 2,50,000 for seeding health technology innovations. An MoU was signed between the institute and Mr. Ajay Dubey on 06 Dec. 2022 at IIT Kanpur who generously contributed towards instituting âRooma & Ajay Dubey Healthcare Innovation & Ideation Programâ (HII Program) which aims to seed and nurture innovations in health technology and build an ecosystem and nurture students start-ups in the domain of HealthTech. This program will expose students to various problem statements and motivate them to come up with technology solutions, and develop technological ideas for the betterment of the healthcare system. Under the umbrella of SIIC, students will get funding and networking opportunities to fast-track their growth and build a culture of entrepreneurship.

IITK alumnus and faculty, Prof. Rajat Moona gets appointed as the next Director of the Indian Institute of Technology Gandhinagar . He currently serves as the Director of IIT Bhilai. Prof. Moona did his B.Tech. from Indian Institute of Technology, Kanpur in Electrical Engineering in 1985. He later joined IITK as a faculty in the Dept. of Computer Science & Engineering.

Prof. Ratnesh Kumar has been awarded the Outstanding Achievement in Research by Iowa State University for exemplary national and international reputation for #contribution in #research and dedication for guiding and influencing research of #students. He is the Barbara & James R. Palmer Professor in the Electrical & Computer Engineering Dept. of the university.His research interests are in the fields of #Sensors, #Networks, #Controls, and #Software with #application #domains of Safety & Security in Cyber-physical (#hybrid).

Our Distinguished alumnus, Prof. K V Subramanian has been named as the Executive Director (India) at the International Monetary Fund. Dr. Subramanian is the former Chief Economic Advisor to the Govt. of India and is a leading expert on economic policy, banking, and corporate governance.

IITK Distinguished alumnus, Dr. Rakesh K. Jain (BT/CHE/1972) gets selected to receive 2022 Szent-GyÃ¶rgyi Prize for Progress in Cancer Research. Dr. Jain is being recognized for his pioneering research and breakthrough discoveries on overcoming barriers posed by the tumor microenvironment (TME) which led to the improved delivery and efficacy of anti-cancer medicines. His groundbreaking and innovative research has fundamentally transformed the understanding of tumor biology and directly informed the development and approval of new drug-combinations to treat cancer patients.

The Szent-GyÃ¶rgyi Prize for Progress in Cancer Research is named in memory of Dr. Albert Szent-GyÃ¶rgyi, NFCRâs co-founder and 1937 Nobel Laureate for his study of vitamin C and cell respiration. The annual Prize honors scientists whose seminal discovery or pioneering body of work has contributed to cancer prevention, diagnosis, or treatment and has had a lasting impact on understanding cancer, holding the promise of improving or saving lives of cancer patients. Dr. Rakesh K. Jain will be honored at the Szent-GyÃ¶rgyi Prize award ceremony on October 22, 2022, at The National Press Club in Washington, D.C.

Prof. Ashutosh Sharma (BT/CHE/1982) was selected as the President of the Indian National Science Academy in June 2022. He is an Institute Fellow and Distinguished Alumnus of IITK. Prof. Sharma served as the Secretary of the Department of Science and Technology, Government of India. He is a recipient of the prestigious Shanti Swarup Bhatnagar award in engineering sciences for his "original pioneering contribution to the understanding of the behavior of thin films and other highly confined nanoscale systems." For More

Prof. Jayathi Murthy (BT/ME/1979) was elected as the President of the Oregon State University, USA, in June 2022. She is the first woman Dean of the School of Engineering & Applied Science at UCLA. Prof. Murthy is also a Professor at UCLAâs Mechanical & Aerospace Department. She is a member of the National Academy of Engineering, USA; Fellow of the American Society of Mechanical Engineers. For More
